Joel Lehman and I are pleased to announce our new publication to appear at =
GECCO this year, "Revising the Evolutionary Computation Abstraction: Minima=
l Criteria Novelty Search" :  

http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/publications/2010/l=
ehman.gecco10a.html
Direct: http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/papers/lehman_gecco10a.=
pdf

It introduces an extension to the original novelty search algorithm ca=
lled "minimal criteria novelty search" (MCNS).  The MCNS algorithm addresse=
s the concern with the original novelty search algorithm that it is "too op=
en-ended" and therefore may get lost meandering off to nowhere in some sear=
ch spaces.  MCNS adds a constraint that keeps the search in a sane area of =
the search space while still driving search through novelty alone.  The pap=
er also discusses the philosophical motivation for MCNS as an alternative a=
bstraction of natural evolution to the pervasive fitness-pressure-centered =
paradigm in EC.

ken
